programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: The open arenas of grassland and desert make up half of all land on our planet. In these exposed habitats, predators like cheetahs, bald eagles and lions can usually see their prey. But it works both ways: their prey can see them too.

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: The coast is the only place on the planet where predators from air, land and sea come together; powered by the tides and thrashed by waves, this is a world of continuous change. Opportunities never last long, so hunters are always in a race against time.

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: The contests between predators and prey are the most dramatic events in nature. The premiere episode reveals the extraordinary range of techniques predators use to catch their prey.

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: This episode looks at the challenges of hunting in the Arctic, the most seasonal place on Earth. To a predator, seasonal change is a problem; it means that all the parameters of the hunt change too.

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: Follow tigers, harpy eagles, chimpanzees, army ants and other predators as they rise to the challenge of hunting within the forest. The prize for succeeding at nature's great game of hide-and-seek is one worth winning.

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: This episode follows blue whales, sharks, sea lions and dolphins to reveal the strategies they use to hunt for prey. The ocean is an immense wilderness; predators face an endless search to find and catch food, yet the ocean is home to remarkable hunters.

programme.title: Planet Earth II

programme.title: Planet Earth II

programme.desc: Game Warden Eddins helps a neighbour in need. Reneau responds to a call about a baby red-tailed hawk. Game Warden Richards attempts to serve an arrest warrant. Game Warden Startz patrols solo on the Guadalupe River. Wardens monitor the Rio Grande.

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: In Texas, a woman is found in distress on the side of the highway. Warden Hensz handles an aggressive family of owls, while Warden Bailey responds to a call about underage drinkers holding a fishing tournament.

programme.desc: Foolhardy speedsters run afoul of wardens on a nighttime stakeout mission. Game Warden Mike Boone investigates reckless gunfire endangering life and property, and Game Warden Chelsea Bailey crosses paths with a wanted man during a routine safety check.

programme.title: John Adams
programme.desc: A new period of separation from Abigail looms as Adams is appointed Minister to France. But after a rough ocean voyage, Adams finds himself at odds with the French style of politics. Vexed, Adams heads to Holland to raise funds.

programme.title: John Adams
programme.desc: Convalescing, Adams learns of the British surrender and of the new Dutch feeling toward America. Abigail joins him in Paris, where they fall under its spell, but when the presidential election looms, Adams must put his life on hold.

programme.title: John Adams
programme.desc: As Vice President, Adams feels excluded from Washington's inner circle, and a strain develops on his relationship with Jefferson. Later elected president, he bares the burdens of a nation with an uncertain future.

programme.title: John Adams
programme.desc: Abandoned by Jefferson for retaining Washington's cabinet, President Adams holds firm on keeping his nation out of war. Adams faces a crisis at home when he disowns his alcoholic son, Charles.

programme.title: John Adams

programme.desc: A boy who can twist his head 180 degrees and face directly behind him resembles infamous accounts of demonic possession from horror films; experts use cutting-edge technology to find out what's giving him this extreme ability.

programme.title: Strange Evidence
programme.desc: A bizarre explosion is captured that morphs into a sinister black ring of smoke above a California football stadium; experts investigate and uncover an underground network of Satanists with connections to a string of modern-day terrorist plots.

programme.title: Ancient Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Experts unearth what appears to be a mysterious hole to hell surrounded by cryptic Pagan carvings in rural England; experts use state-of-the-art forensics to investigate and uncover the dark secrets of this mystical site.

programme.title: If We Built It Today
programme.desc: The legend of the lost city of Atlantis is one of history's greatest mysteries, and cutting-edge tech could bring it back to life; experts use modern engineering to reveal if it's possible to build a megacity underwater.

programme.title: Mysteries of the Abandoned
